dialogues.text: Standing in a nonexistent set is ANDY KAUFMAN, looking a nervous.  Wide-eyed, tentative, he stares at us with a needy, unsettling cuteness.  His hair is slicked-down, an he wears the "FRIENDLY WORLD" costume from the Andy Kaufm special. Finally, Andy speaks -- in a peculiar FOREIGN ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: Hallo.  I am Andy.  Welcoom to my movie. (beat; he gets upset) I hoped the story of my life would be nice...but it turned out terrible!  It is all LIES!  Tings are mixed up... real people I knew play different people.  WHAT A MESS! So I broke into Universal and cut out the junk.  Now it's much shorter.  In fact, this is the end of the movie.  So tanks for comink! Bye-bye! Andy puts a needle on a phonograph, and swelling CLOSING CREDITS MUSIC starts to play.  FINAL CREDITS roll. Andy stands frozen, awkwardly looking at the audience. Every time the music ends he picks up the needle and restarts the music.  He does that as many times as the credits require. Finally, CREDITS END.  And then--a sly smile.  He leans i DROPS HIS ACCENT and WHISPERS.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS REGULAR VOICE)
dialogues.text: Okay!  Just my friends are left.  I wanted to get rid of those other people... they would have laughed in the wrong places. (beat) I was only kidding about the movie... it's actually PRETTY GOOD! It shows everything... from me as a little boy until my death -- (his eyes pop; he covers his mouth) Oops!!  I wasn't supposed to talk about that!  Oh.  Eh, uh, we better just begin.  It starts back in Great Neck, Long Island... Andy turns to a primitive 16mm PROJECTOR and turns it on. WHIR!  He smiles at the flickering light.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.  I remember it well... We PUSH INTO the white light.  It fills our frame, blazin whiter, whiter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK AND WHITE image slowly becomes COLOR.  Great Neck 1957.  An upper-class Jewish neighborhood.  In the street crewcut BOYS play t-ball, laughing and shouting.  A fat convertible pulls up to the smallest house, and STANLEY KAUFMAN, 40, gets out.  Still in his suit, he's a well- meaning slave to his job -- tired, responsible. Stanley goes over to admire the t-ball game.  At bat is h son MICHAEL, 6, a natural charmer.  Michael swings -- cra -- and hits a solid single.  Stanley smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: That's my boy!  Good swingin', kiddo. (warm beat; then a look) Hey -- Michael... where's your brother?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: He's inside. Instantly -- Stanley's mood turns black.  He frowns angri then snatches his briefcase and marches in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby CAROL is crying.  Mom JANICE, 35, quickly peels carrots, trying to get dinner made.  Stanley marches past

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Is he in his room?

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: Of course he's in his room. (aggravated) All his "friends" are in there. Stanley glowers.  He huffs upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stanley hurries up to Andy's shut door.  We hear little A doing VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (as WORRIED GIRL) But professor, why are the monsters growing so big? (now as BRITISH

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: It's something in the jungle water. I need to crack the secret code. Stanley rolls his eyes.  He opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...revealing ANDY, 8, performing for the wall.  Andy is happy and enthusiastic... as long as he's acting.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (as BRITISH

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Maybe I should talk to the natives. (as dancing NATIVES) Shoom boom boo ba!  Shoom boom boo ba --

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Andy!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (startled) Oh! The boy suddenly turns off, becoming introverted... awkwa Frustrated, Stanley stares at his son.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Andy, this has to stop.  Our house isn't a television station.  There is not a camera in that wall. Andy glances over at the wall.  Hmm. STANLEY (cont'd) (trying to cope) Son... listen to me.  It isn't healthy.  You should be outside, playing sports.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: But I've got a sports show. Championship wrestling, at five.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: (he blows his top) You know that's not what I meant! Look, I'm gonna put my foot down! No more playing alone.  You wanna perform, you GOTTA have an audience!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (he points at the wall) B-but I have them.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: No!  That is NOT an audience!  That is PLASTER!  An audience is people made of flesh!  They -- live and breathe!  Got it?! Andy thinks, considering his options.  Then, he nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Carol sits in her crib.  Andy's hands suddenly YANK out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy hurries in and plops Carol down on the floor.  She dutifully sits there, deadpan. Andy returns to the center of the room.  He resumes his show.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (as KIDDIE SHOW

dialogues.speaker: HOST
dialogues.text: And now, boys and girls!  It's time for... TV Fun House! (he makes an

dialogues.speaker: APPLAUSE SOUND
dialogues.text: Hi, everybody!  Are you ready for a singalong?  I'll say the animal, and you make his sound!  Okay...?  Okay! (he starts to SING) "Oh, the cow goes........." Carol stares, unblinking.  Then --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Moo.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (he smiles, pleased) "And the dog goes......"

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: "And the cat says......"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on ANDY, now GROWN UP.  26-years-old, still perform the song.

dialogues.speaker: MEOW
dialogues.text: WIDE - It's a small, hip New York nightclub.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: "And the bird says..."

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: "And the lion goes..."

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: "And that's the way it goes!" (he grins) Thank you.  Goodbye! Andy waves and bows.  There's faint scattered applause. Andy sighs.  An irritated MANAGER steps onstage.  He shoo Andy a disgruntled look, then takes the mike.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: The comedy stylings of Andy Kaufman, Ladies and Gentlemen! In the b.g., Andy starts packing up his props: Hand puppe conga drums, a phonograph... it all goes into a big bulky case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club is empty.  At the bar, the manager cleans up.  A eagerly comes over.  Offstage, his presence is soft, plac -- his voice barely above a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: So, Mr. Besserman, same slot tomorrow...?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: (awkward) Eh, I dunno... Andy.  I'm... thinkin' of letting you go...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You're firing me?? (beat) You don't even pay me!

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Look -- I don't wanna seem insulting.  But... your act is like amateur hour: Singalongs... puppets... playing records... A stunned beat.  Andy is hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What do you want?  "Take my wife, please"??

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Sure!  Comedy!  Make jokes about the traffic.  Do impressions.  Maybe a little blue material...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I don't swear.  I -- I don't do what everyone else does!

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Well, everyone else gets this place cookin'!  Pal, it's hard for me to move the booze when you're singin' "Pop Goes The Weasel." Andy stares, disheartened. MANAGER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  You're finished here. An uncomfortable beat -- and then Andy starts crying. The manager is dumbfounded.  He doesn't know what to do. Tears are rolling pitifully down Andy's cheeks.  The mana is confused -- totally disoriented.  Shamed, Andy covers face, then runs out.  Silence.  The manager stares after him... having no idea what just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sobbing Andy bursts out the door.  He steps onto the sidewalk -- and IMMEDIATELY STOPS CRYING.  Just like that Andy lifts his big case and starts walking.  Andy shakes head angrily. He turns down a dark street, hurrying alone through an unsavory New York neighborhood.  But then... TWO MEN appear... silently approaching.  Andy stops uncertainly - debating whether to turn around.  But in that second -- t thugs are upon him, glaring menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Give us your wallet. Andy stares fearfully.  An anxious moment.  He thinks... considering his options. Then, he suddenly stammers in a thick FOREIGN ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: I -- doo not unterstand!!

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Give us your money!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: What??  What mooney?  Abu daboo!  I do not have mooney! The thugs glance at each other. ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd) Pleaze!  I just move to America yezterday!  I do not know!

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: What's in the case?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: NO!  Eeet, eet is just perzonal trifles from my homeland --

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Gimme that thing! The guy snatches the case.  He impulsively BREAKS the lock... and clothes, congas and records fall out. The thugs are dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Goddamn immigrants!

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: This guy's pathetic.  Let's go. Harsh glances.  They angrily turn and leave. Andy takes a nervous breath, then starts picking his thin off the street.  He shouts after the guys:

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: Tank you veddy much...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Improv, the biggest comedy club around.  People are lined up, waiting.  The man strides up -- GEORGE SHAPIRO, Hollywood talent manager.  George is old school: Bronx accent, shmooze and a hug... but with a surprising sweetn that is quite disarming.  A DOORMAN sees him, grins, and waves George in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar is packed with COMICS and SHOW BIZ TYPES.  A few turn and smile -- "George!"  "Hey, George!"  George takes couple hands, whispers to someone else, then drifts into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the show's in progress.  Owner BUDD FRIEDMAN sees George and gives him a bear-hug.  Then he hustles George a table. George sits -- and gives the stage his undivided attentio Up there is a WISEASS COMIC.

dialogues.speaker: WISEASS COMIC
dialogues.text: So I'm getting my mother-in-law a special Christmas present: A pre- paid funeral!  The mortician asked me if I wanted her buried, embalmed or cremated.  I said, "Make it all three!  I'm not takin' any chances!" (the crowd LAUGHS) Thank you.  Good night! The comic waves and exits.  APPLAUSE.  George politely claps.  A PIANO PLAYER jumps in with an upbeat show tune. We think there's a break... when Andy suddenly, awkwardly steps on stage.  He is in character as Foreign Man.  Pink jacket, tie, hair slicked back, frightened like a deer in headlights.  He puts down his big case, pulls out various junk, and arranges it on chairs. The room hushes, uncertain as to who the hell this guy is Andy tentatively grabs the mike.  The stagefright is agon

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: Now?  Now...? (looking around) Tank you veddy much.  I am very happy to be here.  I tink -- this is a very beautiful place.  But one ting I do not like is too much traffic.  Tonight I had to come from, eh, and the freeway, it was so much traffic.  It took me an hour and a half to get here! Andy chuckles, as if this were a punchline. Silence.  The crowd is baffled. ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd) But -- talking about the terrible things: My wife.  Take my wife, please take her. Yikes.  A few NERVOUS LAUGHS. Andy gestures, as if they got the joke. ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd) No really, I am only foolink.  I love my wife very much.  But she don't know how to cook.  You know, one time, she make a steak and mashed potato.  Ehh, and the night before, she make spaghetti and meatballs.  Her cooking is so bad... is terrible. People are embarrassed.  Some avert their eyes.  A couple hipsters laugh mockingly. George leans forward.  Andy wipes the sweat from his brow ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, I would like to do for you some imitations.  So first, I would like to imitate Archie Bunker. (no change in his voice) "You stupid, everybody ees stupid! Ehh, get, get out of my chair Meathead... go in the, eh, Dingbat get into the kitchen, making the food!  Ehh, everybody ees stupid!  I don't like nobody, ees so stupid!" Tank you veddy much. (pleased, he proudly bows) Now I would like to imitate Jimmy Carter, the President of the United States. (no change in his voice) "Hello, I am Jimmy Carter, the President of the United States." Some people BOO and walk out.  A few giggle, getting into the groove. George is intrigued. ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd) And now... I would like to imitate the Elvis Presley. A woman LAUGHS caustically.  Andy grins stupidly, then tu his back to us.  He presses "Play" on a CASSETTE RECORDER and the THEME FROM 2001 starts playing. House lights dim dramatically.  With a flourish, Andy pul tape off his pants -- revealing rhinestones.  He removes pink coat -- putting on a white jeweled jacket. He combs his hair. Then he brushes his hair. Then he combs his hair some more. Finally he picks up a guitar, strikes a pose -- and spins around. He is ELVIS.  CONFIDENT.  SEXY.  LIP CURL.  DEAD-ON PERFE The crowd is blown away. Vegas Elvis INTRO MUSIC suddenly blasts.  Andy/Elvis swaggers stage left and takes a bow.  Then he goes stage right and takes a bow.  Then he returns stage left for another bow. Music STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS ELVIS)
dialogues.text: Thank you very much. Wow.  Flabbergasted, people APPLAUD.  This man is Elvis. Suddenly -- "JAILHOUSE ROCK" guitar kicks in. ANDY (AS ELVIS) (cont'd) (SINGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Warden threw a party In the county jail! Prison band was there And they BEGAN to WAIL!"

dialogues.text: He is astonished.  George cannot quite figure out what's going on... but he wants in. He waves Budd over.  Budd leans down, and George WHISPERS

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Pst.  What's the story with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: BUDD
dialogues.text: I think he's Lithuanian.  None of us can understand him. George nods admiringly.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He does a hell of an Elvis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is packing up his things.  He very methodically fold each item of clothing, then checks the creases. George strolls up.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hey, I really enjoyed your set.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: Tank you veddy much.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So I understand you're from Lithuania?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: No.  Caspiar. George is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Caspiar?  I haven't heard of that.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS FOREIGN MAN)
dialogues.text: It's a veddy small island in de Caspian Sea. (beat) It sunk.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh.  Hm.  I'm uh, sorry. (beat) Well, look, I'm probably out of my mind -- but I think you're very interesting.  If you ever need representation... we should talk. George hands him a BUSINESS CARD.  Andy reads it -- then eyes pop.  He DROPS the accent.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Mr. Shapiro, it's an honor!! George realizes it's all been an act.  He laughs heartily

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Caspiar, huh?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bohemian health food restaurant, staffed by hippie waitresses in sandals.  Andy and George sit together, try to get a sense of each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You see, I want to be the biggest star in the world. George is surprised at this hubris.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: People love... comedians.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I'm not a comedian.  I have no talent. (he shrugs) I'm a song-and-dance man. George looks up at Andy -- and inexplicably there is a gi MOIST BOOGER hanging from Andy's nostril. George cringes.  He doesn't know what to say. A waitress brings over two plates of awful 70's HEALTH FO -- seaweed, beans, stringy paste.  George frowns.  Andy beams. ANDY (cont'd) Mmm!  I particularly recommend the Lotus root. Andy pulls out a little Handi-wipe and cleanses his hands Then he starts arranging the food in compulsive little piles: Beans in pinwheel shapes.  Sprouts in piles. George peers at the bizarre food behavior. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You show a lot of promise... but... my concern is I don't know where to book you.  You're not a stand-up... your act doesn't exactly translate to films... help me... where do you see yourself?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (bright) I've always wanted to play Carnegie Hall. George is unsure if that's a joke.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, ha-ha.  That's funny. Andy dips his silverware in the water glass.  Two dunks, then he dries it with his napkin. George stares, perplexed.  He looks back up -- and Andy's booger has suddenly switched nostrils. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: See, I don't want easy laughs. Andy's about to eat -- but first bows his head in silent prayer.  George raises an eyebrow.  Andy snaps his head b up. ANDY (cont'd) I want gut reactions!  I want that audience to go through an experience.  They love me!  They hate me!  They walk out -- it's all

dialogues.speaker: GREAT
dialogues.text: Andy triumphantly eats a bean.  George peers, unable to t the booger anymore.  He hands Andy a napkin and points to his nose.  Andy nods, removes the rubber booger, and carefully puts it in a little box. ANDY (cont'd) After I'm famous, I can sell these as "Worn by Andy Kaufman." And at that... George is won over.  He smiles broadly.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You're insane. (then sincere) But -- you might also be brilliant. Alright, Andy... let's do it. George warmly extends his hand. Andy slowly smiles, then takes George's hand.  The men shake.  A moment of supreme importance.

dialogues.speaker: EST. BEVERLY HILLS
dialogues.text: The glitz strip of Los Angeles.  Money.  Beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real working showbiz offices.  No glamour at all.  It loo more like an insurance agency. George sits in his office, reassuring someone on the phon

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sammy, opening for David Brenner is a fine gig.  You'll be on the road... get some exposure... O.S., a SECRETARY shouts out.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Tony Clifton on the phone!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He says he's an associate of Andy Kaufman's.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh. (back to the phone) Sammy, think about it.  I gotta go. (he punches a line) Hello?  George Shapiro here. On the phone, a STACCATO, ABRASIVE NASAL VOICE blares.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.  Is this GEORGE SHAPIRO?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (beat) Er, yes.  Speaking.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "Speaking"!  Reeking, seeking, creaking... Freaking! George is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah!  You stay away from that Andy Kaufman, if you know what's good for you!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (stunned) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You -- you know damn straight who it is.  Tony Clifton!  A name to respect.  A name to fear. (beat) Beer.  Gear.  Deer.  Ear.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Look... I don't know what your problem is...

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kaufman's a lying bastard!  If you sign him, I'll RUIN YOU! CLICK.  Clifton hangs up.  George is bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light is magical.  Soothing SITAR music plays.  Andy fifteen other BAREFOOT STUDENTS sit on mats in a semi- circle.  Eyes shut, bodies in different yoga positions, t are all meditating. Facing them on a throne-like chair sits a reverent, India YOGI.  At his feet is the class teacher, LITTLE WENDY, a teeny lady with an absurdly high-pitched voice.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE WENDY
dialogues.text: Now, while continuing your deep breathing, slowly open your eyes. You should feel rested, relaxed, and alert. The students all open their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: YOGI
dialogues.text: Do any thoughts come...?

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: My mind is clear.  I feel great.

dialogues.speaker: YOGI
dialogues.text: Good...

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: All the tension is gone from my body. The Yogi's eyes go to Andy.  Andy smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I want to thank you, your Holiness. My heart is radiating with pure energy. The Yogi nods kindly.

dialogues.speaker: YOGI
dialogues.text: You always had a good heart.  But I'm proud of the progress you've made in your discipline. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  TM got me focused.  In fact, my manager got me a TV gig!  It's just some new show with no budget, but I'm still excited. Oh.  The Yogi peers intently.

dialogues.speaker: YOGI
dialogues.text: Are you at peace with your family?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Um, yes.  I haven't fought with them, since I started here.

dialogues.speaker: YOGI
dialogues.text: Goals are important.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I stopped drinking.  I gave up drugs.  And I'm meditating three hours a day.  It's the center of my life...

dialogues.speaker: YOGI
dialogues.text: We are all impressed. Andy smiles beatifically.  This means a lot.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE WENDY
dialogues.text: Okay.  Anyone else --?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, wait!  I have a question. (beat; working up his nerve) Is there... is there a secret to being funny? Huh?  The Yogi thinks hard... squinching up his face. Then... he finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: YOGI
dialogues.text: Yes.  Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AUDIENCE sits, waiting for the commercial to end. TECHIES tweak lights.  CAMERAMEN get ready. Sitting in VIP seats are Andy's FAMILY.  Stanley and Jani are in their late 50's, Michael and Carol in their 20's. They're all anxious.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I still can't believe my brother's gonna be on TV...!

dialogues.speaker: JANICE
dialogues.text: I hope he doesn't get nervous. STANLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference?  This thing's on in the middle of the night -- no one's even gonna see it. The commercial ends, and the "APPLAUSE" sign blinks.  The crowd APPLAUDS.  An "ON THE AIR" sign lights up.

dialogues.speaker: HOST
dialogues.text: Welcome back to Saturday Night Live! And now, as a special treat on our first show... musical guest ANDY

dialogues.speaker: KAUFMAN
dialogues.text: The SNL orchestra starts the intro into a song.  Andy ent the stage with a boom box, and positions himself in front the microphone.  When the vocals are supposed to start, A doesn't open his mouth.  Instead he looks around -- frightened.  The band stops... and starts again.  Andy remains mute.  The Band stops again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SNL producer, LORNE MICHAELS, looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: LORNE MICHAELS
dialogues.text: What's happening to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, Andy puts the boom box down and blares it loudly.  The THEME FROM "MIGHTY MOUSE" plays -- but Andy just blankly stands there. He's purposefully doing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MIGHTY MOUSE THEME, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "Although we are in danger, We never despair, Because we know where there is danger He is there!" The audience is puzzled.  The Kaufmans are alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lorne Michaels is panicked.

dialogues.speaker: LORNE MICHAELS
dialogues.text: Oh my God, he's doing nothing.  It's dead air...!

dialogues.speaker: MIGHTY MOUSE THEME, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: "We're not worrying at all. We're just listening for his call..." Then SUDDENLY -- Andy comes to life and triumphantly LIP SYNCS. MIGHTY MOUSE THEME (V.O.) (cont'd) "Here I come to save the day!" Shocked, the crowd HOWLS with LAUGHTER. Then instantly -- Andy resumes his blank expression. MIGHTY MOUSE THEME (V.O.) (cont'd) "That means that Mighty Mouse is on the way!" The audience SCREAMS with glee.  The tune ENDS, and the audience APPLAUDS CRAZILY. Delighted, Andy grins and bows. The Kaufmans clap the hardest.  Stanley locks eyes with Andy... and the beaming father smiles the proudest of all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George jumps from his desk.  Andy is walking in.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Andy, c'mon IN!  Thanks for flyin' out here!!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: The stewardess let me keep my headphones.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That's... terrific!  But I got something better.  This is BIG... (giddy; milking the moment) You are getting a once-in-a- lifetime, unbelievably lucrative opportunity to star on... a

dialogues.speaker: PRIMETIME NETWORK SITCOM
dialogues.text: Andy's smile drops.  He freezes up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Sitcom...?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And this is a CLASS ACT!  It's the guys who did the Mary Tyler Moore and Bob Newhart shows!  It takes place in a taxi stand!  And you're gonna be the Fonzie!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (confused) I'm -- Fonzie? GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!  The Fonzie!  The crazy breakout character!  The guy that all the kids impersonate and put on their lunchboxes!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (soft) George, I hate sitcoms.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: HANG ON, you ain't heard the best part!  ABC has seen your foreign man character, and they want to turn him into -- (he checks his notes) "Latka," a lovable, goofy mechanic!!! Long pause.  Then -- Andy responds.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: "No"?  "No" to which part??

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: No to the whole thing.  None of it sounds good. George is flummoxed.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Andy... this is every comedian's dream.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm not a comedian.  And sitcoms are the lowest form of entertainment: Stupid jokes and canned laughter.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (shocked) B-but, this is classy... they did Bob Newha--

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I'm not interested.  I want to create my own material. Beat.  George glares.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I refuse. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he explodes) LISTEN, you arrogant putz!  I've been in this business for twenty years!  I know!  If you walk away from this opportunity, you will never, NEVER see another one like it again!!!! Long pause.  Andy stares at George, amazed at this passio Then Andy gets up and looks around the office.  He stares the awards... the gold records... emblems of success and experience. Andy thinks -- then nods.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Okay.  Fine, I'll do it. (beat) But I have a few terms.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (relieved) Of course!  That's what negotiations are for. Andy starts to write on a piece of paper. GEORGE (cont'd) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Writing down my terms. George watches patiently. Andy clicks his pen, done.  George smiles and takes the list.  He scans it... then his face gets totally befuddle

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Are you makin' fun of me --?  This is RIDICULOUS!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (blasР№) Those are my terms.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: They're IMPOSSIBLE!!  Jesus! (he points at one item) I mean -- "two guaranteed guest shots for Tony Clifton"                          Who is this TONY CLIFTON?!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: He's a Vegas entertainer.  I used to do impressions of him.  We sorta... got in a fight over that. George gets a look.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: This Clifton called me up.  He's a loon!  He HATES you! ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, he just talks tough.  But I owe him one. Andy smiles ingenuously, then turns stern. ANDY (cont'd) If I'm the new Fonz... ABC's just gonna have to give me what I want. (a sarcastic FONZIE

dialogues.speaker: IMPRESSION
dialogues.text: Heyyyyyy! George winces.  He stares at the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sits across a conference table from three NETWORK SUITS.  He stoically reads the men his demands.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Mr. Kaufman will only appear in half the episodes. (beat) Mr. Kaufman requires an undisturbed 90 minutes of meditation prior to filming. (beat) Mr. Kaufman won't rehearse. (beat) Mr. Kaufman gets his own network Special. The execs are stupefied.  Finally -- George delivers the clincher. GEORGE (cont'd) And Taxi must guarantee two guest appearances to... Tony Clifton.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Tony Clifton.

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK GUY
dialogues.text: Who is he?!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (solemn) I don't know. Long pause.  The execs stare at George like he's lost his mind. GEORGE (cont'd) But Andy says he's fabulous. (awkward) He also says, these are the terms. The execs' leader, MAYNARD SMITH, shudders hopelessly. NETWORK GUY #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't Kaufman ask for more money, like everyone else? George slowly, sadly shakes his head:  No. Maynard glances at his team -- then frowns. MAYNARD (cont'd) George, we don't book phantom performers.  The deal's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE throws his attachР№ case on the desk, then slumps his chair.  He picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Andy?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi George!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Eh, hi, Andy.  Look, this Tony Clifton... is he performing anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Of course. (beat) But only on Monday nights.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That's alright.  Where...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama Roma's, a dark Italian restaurant with red booths, w guys, and cigarette smoke. The Maitre'd guides George to a booth.  A small BAND fill the "stage" -- a six-foot space in the back of the room. The lights dim.  A BLARING ANNOUNCER speaks.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And now, Mama Roma's is proud to present International Singing Sensation... a man who has sold more records than Elvis and the Beatles combined... George is skeptical. ANNOUNCER (V.O.) (cont'd) Ladies and Gentlemen, Mr. Entertainment... TONY CLIFTON! The DRUMMER starts a drum roll.  Patrons APPLAUD.  A LIGH SPOT hits the entrance area... and nobody enters.  The sp is waiting... waiting... still waiting... until the drum roll slows down and stops.  The announcer BOOMS again. ANNOUNCER (V.O.) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, out of respect for Mr. Clifton's vocal demands, could everyone please extinguish your cigarettes and cigars. The crowd GRUMBLES angrily -- then irritably complies.  O ANGRY GUY thrusts his cigar into a water glass.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY GUY
dialogues.text: Goddamn, I paid five dollars for this.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And now!  A man who needs no introduction... TONY CLIFTON! The band starts playing lounge standard "VOLARE".  And th obnoxious TONY CLIFTON swaggers out.  Tony has a rubbery face, black wig and moustache, sunglasses, a padded belly and a peach tuxedo with blue shirt and velvet piping. Tony stops, smirks at the audience, and sucks on a cigarette.  He blows smoke rings at them.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: Heh-heh.  How ya all doin'? The crowd is furious.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY GUY
dialogues.text: Fuck you! People light back up and start talking.  Tony ignores the ruckus.  He starts SINGING, pinched and off-key.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: (singing) "Volare! Whoa, whoa. Cantare, Whoa whoa whoa whoa." George winces.  He's horrible. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) (singing) "I got the wings of your love, I got the wings of a dove. I got the... uh... (forgetting the words) ... the chicken wings from Eh, Kentucky Fried..." The band is lost. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) Oh.  Whoop do doo, Whoop de di, Stick a needle in your eye... The band gives up and stops. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, the hell with that song. One person CLAPS.  Most BOO. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) So how ya doin'! (leering) How ya doin' over here?  How ya doin' over there? (he approaches a

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: How's that pasta carbonara?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: Okay! (he spins around) So, you havin' a good time, sir?! Tony approaches a LONELY SAD SACK sitting at the bar.  To thrusts his mike at the guy.

dialogues.speaker: SAD SACK
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: SAD SACK
dialogues.text: Bob.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: (he reacts as if this is enormously funny) "Bob"?  BOB!  Bob bob bob. (beat) Bob what?

dialogues.speaker: SAD SACK
dialogues.text: Bob Gorsky.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: "Gorsky"?  What is that, Polish?

dialogues.speaker: SAD SACK
dialogues.text: (meek) Yes. Tony gets indignant.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: Are you tryin' to do some of that Polack humor?  Well if that's so, you can just get the hell out of this restaurant!

dialogues.speaker: SAD SACK
dialogues.text: (timid) It's my name.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: SHUT UP!  I hate them Polish jokes! People are embarrassed. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) I do a clean show!  Like, I wouldn't do that one... oh, you know it... "What do you call a pretty girl in Poland"?

dialogues.speaker: SAD SACK
dialogues.text: (he giggles stupidly) A -- a tourist.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: See, that's EXACTLY what I'm talkin' about! (enraged) Here!  I'LL give you a little humor! Tony snatches Bob's water glass and POURS IT over his hea George is appalled.  The crowd is aghast.  Bob is wet. People BOO AND HURL THINGS. Bob starts weeping, then bolts up and runs from the building. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) And stay out, Fatso! The room erupts, outraged.  George covers his face, looki ill.  Suddenly, Tony snaps at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: And YOU.  I wanna see you backstage! George is rattled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen staff is working.  George wanders around... t finally spots Tony, back to us, eating pasta at the employees' table.  Aggravated, George aggressively steps

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm here.  What do you want? Tony puts down his fork.  He pauses... slowly turns around... and is Andy. George GASPS.  His eyes bulge. Andy smiles innocently.  He gestures to an empty seat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Are you hungry? George is breathing heavily, like someone about to have a heart attack.  His brain melting, he shakily reaches for chair and sits.  George glances down.  Lying alongside th food is Tony's rubber face.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I... I-I don't understand this act. ANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in jolly spirits) It's good old-fashioned entertainment.  Everyone loves a villain.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Well tell that to the poor schlub who you humiliated! Beat -- then Bob strolls over.  His real name is BOB ZMUD

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: Hey Andy, good show.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Oh George, this is Bob Zmuda.  Bob and I have been buddies for years. George gapes.  On closer inspection, Bob is cocky, aloof, and conniving.  He and Andy grin naughtily at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: That was a really hot house!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So your name's not Gorsky.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: Don't believe everything you hear. George thinks about this -- then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maynard and the ABC suits sit at the table, mesmerized. George is confidentially whispering to them.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: This has to stay in the room... but here's the thing: Andy is Tony.  And Tony is Andy!  They'll deny it up and down, but I swear to God, they're the same person! (with urgency) It's smart business!  You'll get two Andy Kaufmans for the price of one! Maynard thinks about this, quite methodically.  A beat, a then he cracks a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 a.m. in the supermarket.  Just a few people linger... including Andy, who's at the Space Invaders videogame.  A stares intently at the screen, eyes piercing, fingers hammering the buttons while he blows up Martians.  Andy i oblivious to all around him. In the b.g., George suddenly enters.  He looks around the market, then spots Andy.  He feverishly runs up. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (still playing the game) What's up? George grins crazily, ecstatically.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Andy... THEY SAID YES!  They agreed to it all!  They thought your terms were a shining example of your "irreverent wit" -- and precisely why they want you! (beat) You're getting EVERYTHING! Whoa.  Andy looks up, astonished.  His space station EXPLODES, but he doesn't notice.  He turns to George... a slowly smiles sweetly.  Genuinely.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Well thank you very much...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first week of "TAXI."  The CAST rehearses on the Taxi set.  PRODUCERS watch from the bleachers. (The actual TAXI scene will be determined.)  JUDD HIRSCH, TONY DANZA, and MARILU HENNER read their lines. Then... a bored BLACK STAND-IN reads Latka's line. The cast glances around.  Tony Danza loses his temper.

dialogues.speaker: TONY DANZA
dialogues.text: Man, this is bullshit! (he marches up to the PRODUCER) Where's Kaufman?  Why isn't he here?? One producer stands.  This is tightly-wound ED WEINBERGER

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: You'll see him on Friday when we shoot.  Now run the lines with Rodney. An angry beat.  The actors resume...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE is filtering in.  They fill the studio bleachers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actors mingle outside the dressing rooms. JUDD HIRSCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking bets we do the show with the stand-in.

dialogues.speaker: MARILU HENNER
dialogues.text: No, I hear Andy arrived.  Rumor is he's locked inside his dressing room. Judd is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is meditating.  He's tranquil, at total inner peace. Silence -- until a little clock radio CHIRPS. Andy snaps his eyes open.  He exhales a few calm breaths, then sits upright.  Andy reaches for a sealed envelope, r it open, and removes a SCRIPT. Andy sighs, opens the script, and starts scanning the pag like a speedreader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bleachers are full.  They're now filming TAXI (the same scene as earlier).  On cue, Andy enters as LATKA -- wide- eyed, endearing, in mechanic's overalls. Andy is hilarious.  The crowd HOWLS with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: TAXI
dialogues.text: In quick succession, a series of Andy's best Latka moment He's beloved.  The applause grows louder, louder, LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAXI curtain calls.  The whole cast takes bows, then runs offstage.  Everyone is grinning -- except Andy. He soberly strolls up to Zmuda.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna quit.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: What?!?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Each show is worse than the next.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: Are you nuts?!  40 million people watch you every week!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: So?  What do they know?

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: Absolutely nothing!  That's the beauty! (he lowers his voice) It's credibility.  You make them love you... and then later, on your special, you'll screw with their heads! Hmm?!  Andy raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power office of Maynard Smith, the powerful ABC exec. He shouts into a phone.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: I don't care!  Travolta signed a contract, he's a Sweathog for life!... Oh yeah?  Just try to sue us. He HANGS up.  His ASSISTANT peeks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Sir, they're having a problem down on the Kaufman Special.  They say he's not following the... technical requirements. Maynard is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: "Technical"???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is in a booth, arguing with a HEAVYSET TECHNICIAN. Zmuda watches and eats a banana.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It's my show!  Now make it roll!

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Maynard strolls up, buttoning his suit jacket, irritated he walks around Little Wendy meditating in front of a rin of candles.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Andy, I hear fabulous things about the Special... (a delicate pause) Eh, I understand we've hit a teeny speedbump?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: (harried) Yeah, Kid Genius told me to mess with the horizontal hold!  He wants the picture to roll! Maynard doesn't exactly understand.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Show me. The technician pushes a button.  ON THE MONITOR - Andy's image briefly appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now... in her television debut, the incredible Chubby Rosalie!! At that moment, Andy's image starts rolling across the screen, until it disappears into a blur of static...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (happy) It'll be great.  The viewer will think their TV is broken.  They'll get out of their chair, they'll twist the knobs, they'll hit the TV, but they won't be able to fix it! Maynard stares at the monitor.  The totally indecipherabl picture still rolls.  A glum pause.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Andy... we don't want the viewer to get out of their chair.  They might change the channel.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: But it's funny!  It's a practical joke.  They'll get frustrated! Andy beams giddily.  Maynard gazes dully, struggling to reason.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Andy... uhh... this network has a long-standing policy: The viewer must be able to see the program.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: But it's only for thirty seconds! Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Twenty!

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Deal. Both men quickly extend their hands and shake.  Maynard n and leaves. Beat.  Then, Andy pulls out a Handi-wipe and cleans his palm. A STUDIO PAGE walks over.  He has a huge MAIL BAG.

dialogues.speaker: STUDIO PAGE
dialogues.text: Mr. Kaufman, do you want your mail? Andy looks up -- and his face lights up like Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's crappy apartment, which looks like a dorm room: Ch furniture, stained carpet, and a framed photo of the Maharishi.  Andy lies on his bed, which is covered with THOUSANDS OF LETTERS.  He happily chats on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: ... Yes, it's Andy Kaufman!... Really! ...I got your fan letter... So you like the show?  Your letter said I was silly.  Did you think I was too silly?... Oh good.  I'm glad. Andy holds a letter which has a GIRL'S SNAPSHOT stapled t it.  He is very nervous. ANDY (cont'd) It was real nice of you to send your picture, Mimi... 'Cause you knew what I looked like... and now, I know what you look like! Andy flips the letter over.  He glances at the return address. ANDY (cont'd) So, um... San Bernardino... (beat) That's just a couple hours away, isn't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is setting.  In an ugly shopping district, Andy walks along with sexy, wholesome MIMI.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: ... so after I finish junior college, I'll go to work for my dad's accounting firm.  Unless, I decide to live with my friend Valerie, but she wants to move to Anaheim, and I don't want to do that. A disinterested beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Oh. Another beat. ANDY (cont'd) So do you wanna wrestle?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- ?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Do you wanna wrestle?  It's a good way of breaking the ice. (pause) That instant physical intimacy really brings two people together. Mimi is bewildered, and offended.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!  We just met an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (calm) No no no, it's not sex!  I mean -- it can lead to sex... but really, it's just wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I don't wanna talk about it! An awkward silence.  They continue walking.  She points u MIMI (cont'd) The sunset is really beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (a bit offput) I mean -- uh -- the colors in the sky are so vibrant.  I love this time of day.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (he shrugs dully) I've never understood that.  It's just... getting dark. (pause) But I like you!  Hey!  Why don't we fill the car with gas, drive to Tijuana, and GET MARRIED???

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Fear.  She shivers, then hoarsely speaks.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I think I wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George screens Andy's TV Special for Maynard and his team The network execs look constipated. ON THE TV - Andy speaks tenderly, lovingly to Howdy Doody

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: You know... I was once in your gallery.  I was just sitting there and I wanted to touch you.  I was kind of depressed because I could see what everyone was like, and I was wondering if, now, maybe I could... touch you. Very gently, Andy touches Howdy's cheek and starts weepin THE EXECS -- are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: (cont'd) Howdy, I've been watching you ever since I was a little boy... (choked up, nervous) You're the first friend from television I ever had.  I always wanted to meet you... and now ...I finally am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is NOT funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ominous) "Artsy Fartsy shit"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried at this response) No... eh, the Special isn't all like this... just wait... it will be hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, the picture turns to FUZZY SNOW.  Maynard scowls.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Christ!  We're the Number One Network -- can't we afford decent TVs?! Maynard angrily jumps and POUNDS on the TV.  BANG, BANG! George winces -- then mutters awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No, um... it's part of the snow. An awful beat. Maynard is embarrassed.  Finally -- he explodes.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD
dialogues.text: Tell Kaufman we will NEVER air this program!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A delicatessen.  Andy wears an apron and angrily cleans tables.  He stacks dirty dishes and wipes up the food.  T BLUE COLLAR GUYS gesture from a booth.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE COLLAR GUY 1
dialogues.text: Excuse me, could I please have more coffee?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, in a sec'. (he lugs the dishes to the kitchen) That was decaf, right? The guy nods.  Andy hurries over with the coffeepot and starts pouring.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE COLLAR GUY 1
dialogues.text: You know, you look just like Andy Kaufman.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get that all the time. Andy hurries off.  The guy's buddy leans in, whispering.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE COLLAR GUY 2
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's him.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE COLLAR GUY 1
dialogues.text: You wanna bet??  If that was him, he wouldn't be workin' here, pouring my coffee!

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Andy dumps out wet coffee grounds.  He is sweating.  In t b.g., George enters the restaurant.  He sees Andy, sits a table and YELLS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hey!  Could you clear this table and bring me a piece of poundcake? Andy turns.  They stare down each other. GEORGE (cont'd) Andy, this is ridiculous.  Take off that apron.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (infuriated) NO!  I'd rather work here, than at ABC.  There's no lying in a restaurant.  They don't promise you a job as a cashier, then suddenly make you a frycook! Andy hurries off with a water pitcher.  George chases him

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry.  They're assholes! But we work in a creative business. You can't predict what people are gonna like --

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: The ONLY reason I did Taxi was so I could have my own Special!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (trying to calm him) Tell you what.  I'll book you on some concerts, and meanwhile, we'll show the Special around... see if somebody wants to buy it --

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (bitter) Yeah, we can have a garage sale. "Hey look, I got a floor lamp and a network TV Special for only fifty cents!" A glum moment. Andy fills water glasses. ANDY (cont'd) How long is left on my Taxi contract?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You signed for five years -- (awkward) So four years, seven months.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (he looks up) Okay... I'll go back.  But just let them know, first they ain't gettin' Latka.  They're gettin' Tony!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. TEXAS A&M COLLEGE AUDITORIUM - NIGHT A marquee says "TEXAS A&M PRESENTS - ANDY KAUFMAN" Inside, a ROAR of APPLAUSE surges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is walking onstage.  The excited CLAPPING swells.  H a gigantic presence to these people. Andy smiles and bows.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Thank you.  It's great to be here. We're going to have a very nice time.  We'll sing some songs --

dialogues.speaker: DO LATKA
dialogues.text: Andy reacts, perturbed.  He struggles to stay composed.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Uh, we'll play with puppets --

dialogues.speaker: LATKA
dialogues.text: Andy scowls.  Then -- he loses it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me one moment. Andy angrily hurries offstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zmuda is with the congas and props.  Andy runs up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Give me the book.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: (startled) No!  Andy, don't do it --

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: They're asking for it. Andy fiercely GRABS a small book from Zmuda.  Zmuda cring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy strides back out.  He gazes at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Since you're such a special audience... I'm going to reveal, for the first time ever, the real me. (he goes into a

dialogues.speaker: ACCENT
dialogues.text: I'm actually British.  I was raised in London and educated at Oxford. And though I dabble in clowning, I do find it so boorish.  So... American. (beat) I prefer the fine arts.  Henceforth, tonight,  I'd like to grace you with a reading of the greatest novel ever written! (he holds up the book) "The Great Gatsby", by F. Scott Fitzgerald!! BEAT. Heh?  The crowd isn't quite clear if this is good or bad. confused murmur. ANDY (BRITISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he cracks open the book) Chapter One. (he starts READING) "In my younger and more vulnerable years, my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.  'Whenever you feel like criticizing anyone,' he told me, 'just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages you've had.'" There's a little NERVOUS LAUGHTER.  Is he really gonna re this? ANDY (BRITISH) (cont'd) "He didn't say any more, but we've always been unusually communicative in a reserved way, and I understood that he meant a great deal more than that..." Suddenly, somebody from the audience screams:

dialogues.speaker: LATKA
dialogues.text: The audience ROARS approvingly.  Andy stops reading and looks at the student.  He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (AS LATKA)
dialogues.text: Tank you veddy much!!!! The audience APPLAUDS enthusiastically.  Andy waits until the applause dies and goes back to the book.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (BRITISH)
dialogues.text: "When I came back from the East last autumn, I felt that I wanted the world to be in uniform and at a sort of moral attention forever; I wanted no more riotous excursions with privileged glimpses into the human heart..." People start BOOING.  Andy looks up. ANDY (BRITISH) (cont'd) Please, let's keep it down.  We have a long way to go. (he resumes reading) "Only Gatsby, the man who gives his name to this book, was exempt from my reaction - Gatsby, who represented everything for which I have an unaffected scorn..." The crowd is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (BRITISH)
dialogues.text: Chapter Two. The crowd is horribly bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock says 11:30.  The PROMOTER glares at Zmuda.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: Is he ever going to stop?

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: (dour) Sure.  When he reaches "The End."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are streaming out.  Maybe fifty are left.  Andy realizes this -- but is committed.  He must continue.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (BRITISH)
dialogues.text: "Tom was evidently perturbed at Daisy's running around alone, for on the following Saturday night he came with her to Gatsby's party.  Perhaps his presence gave the evening its peculiar quality of oppressiveness..." A weak VOICE feebly shouts:

dialogues.speaker: WEAK VOICE
dialogues.text: Do Latka. Andy looks up, shocked.  Insulted, he "blows his temper."

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (BRITISH)
dialogues.text: Look!  I don't have to tolerate this impoliteness!  Forget it -- I'm gonna stop the show.  GOODBYE! He slams the book shut.  People CHEER.  Andy starts to st off -- then turns. ANDY (BRITISH) (cont'd) No, no, I'm only fooling. The audience GROANS. ANDY (BRITISH) (cont'd) I'll tell you what.  Would you rather have me continue reading or would you like to hear the phonograph record? The audience ROARS for the record.  Andy smiles, puts the needle on and to everyone's horror more "Gatsby" comes ou

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (BRITISH-FROM THE RECORD)
dialogues.text: "His presence gave the evening its peculiar quality of oppressiveness - it stands out in my memory from Gatsby's other parties that summer..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are six people left in the audience.  Andy reads on

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (BRITISH)
dialogues.text: "Tomorrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther... And one fine morning - So we beat on, boats against the current borne back ceaselessly into the past." Andy somberly shuts the book. ANDY (BRITISH) (cont'd) The End. A moment of quiet personal euphoria.  Andy looks enraptur the man who has just climbed Everest. A pause -- but no applause.  It's dead silence.  Andy loo out... and realizes the few audience members are asleep. Andy shrugs, then shuffles off-stage. In the wings, Zmuda snores loudly in a folding chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Zmuda walk out, Zmuda squinting groggily.  They drag the suitcase containing the props.  They walk slowly towards their rental car, the campus totally deserted.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: Nobody likes anarchy more than me... but this is science fiction! Andy nods uncomprehendingly.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Let's get some breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is yelling at Andy and Zmuda.  They are seated on couch, heads bowed in shame. GEORGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of show was this                         (angrily reading off a LIST) There were three-hundred walkouts! The promoter wants a refund! Andy mumbles in a pipsqueak whimper.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, George...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You're DAMN RIGHT you're sorry! (turning on Zmuda) And you -- you're the road manager! You should be watchin' out for him!

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: (a guilty sigh) We might have lost our focus... George paces furiously.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: When you play the Midwest and South, you DON'T MINDFUCK THESE PEOPLE! It's not postmodern -- it's rude. (beat) If you wanna perform in Texas, you give 'em Mighty Mouse!  You give 'em Elvis!!

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: But George, I like to push the boundaries...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And that's great.  But do it in LA and New York!  There you experiment! Show up with a sleeping bag and take a nap on stage!  I don't care! Hmm.  Andy thinks.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: How long would they let me sleep?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I don't know! (he composes himself and lowers his voice to a hush) Andy... you need to look inside: Who are you trying to entertain?  The audience... or yourself?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: He doesn't know the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is manically washing his hands.  Using liquid soap f the dispenser, then rubbing his hands under the water.  T more liquid soap.  More rubbing.  Then more liquid soap..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sighs at Zmuda.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'm worried about Andy.  His stress level is affecting his work.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: (he thinks) Isn't Tony Clifton going on Taxi soon?  Maybe that'll chill him out.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Bob, Andy needs to RELAX.  See if you can get him away from all this. Take him to Hawaii, or Bali... Find something special.  Something nice... Zmuda mulls this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tattered sign says "Welcome to the MUSTANG RANCH."  The world-famous whorehouse sits behind a barb-wire fence. Dusty connected trailers sit in the sand. A CAR idles out front.  Zmuda and a scared Andy sit insid

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: I dunno about this... (worried) What will my mother think?

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: She'll say, "Now my son is a man."

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: It's so dirty.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: Nah.  The girls sponge off between johns. Andy nods.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception room -- wood paneling and black-lite poster Music is playing.  Twenty deadpan HOOKERS are lined up. Andy, nervous as a high school kid, points at one... then another... then the first...

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: Which one? Beat -- then Andy becomes GERMAN, with a monocle and stif walk.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (GERMAN)
dialogues.text: I vill haf both!  I vill haf dat fraulein... unt... the vun vith the big strudels! The two chosen girls take Andy's hands and lead him off. reaches the door -- then gives Zmuda a nervous look.  Zmu smiles reassuringly.  Andy gulps, and goes in... Beat.  Zmuda turns to the older, jaded MADAM.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: This is a big day.  It's my friend's first time with a prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: MADAM
dialogues.text: (mocking) What're you talking about?  Andy comes here almost every weekend. Zmuda's jaw drops, stupefied.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: You're talking about... Andy?

dialogues.speaker: MADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, he doesn't always call himself that.  Sometimes he's Tony, and wears a tux. Disbelief -- then Zmuda LAUGHS sharply.  He's been conned

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and the two hookers are WRESTLING.  They grapple and roll around, all three of them in their underwear. Suddenly Andy flips the girls over and pins them with his arms. Breathing hard, he stares down.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: You let me win.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: (she giggles sexily) What if we did...?! Andy grins and leans down...

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: Hey.  If I give you three-hundred dollars, will you come to LA and help me destroy a TV show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Taxi cast sits irritably around a big table, holding scripts.  Ed Weinberger enters.

dialogues.speaker: TONY DANZA
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: He just arrived.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL KANE
dialogues.text: He's an hour late.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Look, I'm told this Clifton guy is a little eccentric.  You're all just gonna have to roll with the punches this week. Suddenly -- the door SLAMS open.  Tony bounds in, filthy drunk, clutching a bottle in a brown bag.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: Taxi!  Laxy!  Just the factsy, Maxie!  Them's all the words that rhyme with taxi!... Right, girls? Little Wendy and the Hooker sashay in, dressed as tarts. Tony feels them up, and they SQUEAL.  The cast stares in horror. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) Eh, why the blue faces?  You musta read the script! (he chuckles) Well, don't worry!  Your pal Tony stayed up all night, writin' some fixes on it. (he pulls out some

dialogues.speaker: SCRIBBLED PAGES
dialogues.text: I added me a musical number, cut out Judd Hirsch, and changed the location to Mardi Gras! Ed's expression goes ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An attempted rehearsal.  Tony is tap-dancing on top of a hood.  He does a "fancy" move, and his booze bottle sudde flies away and CRASHES against the wall. The cast watches, pissed and bored.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: And now, the new theme song! (he starts SINGING) "Oh yes, we drive a taxi, And we're havin' fun. Yeah, we work together, And we get the freakin' job done."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beleaguered Ed sits with George.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: George, we've lost two days. Filming is on Friday.  We HAVE to let him go!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (worried) I'm not sure how Andy's gonna take this...

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: So we'll go downstairs and tell him! He points at Tony, swaggering around on the set.  George shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: But that's Tony down there.  That's not Andy.  Trust me, it's like "Sybil" -- Andy's nowhere on the premises! Ed glares.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Well whoever the fuck that is, I'm firing him!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (he sighs) Okay.  But we'll have to warn Andy first.  I think he's up in San Francisco, doing a concert. Heh?  Ed raises his eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is on the phone.  Ed hovers.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hi, Diane, this is George.  I'm trying to reach Andy up in San Francisco. (a stilted pause) Yeah, I'll wait. Ed glances down at the stage... and suddenly Tony is no longer there.  He's magically vanished. Beat. George turns on the SPEAKERPHONE, then CLICK!  Andy's hap voice pops on the line.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi, George!  Good to hear from you!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hi, Andy.  How's the weather up there?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, you know the Bay Area!  Always foggy! Ed looks totally off-balance.  George winks at him.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'm here with Ed over at Taxi. There's been some trouble with Tony.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh no!  Did he get hurt?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: No, no, Andy, nothing like that. (nervous beat) But... Tony's not fitting in.  His style of performance is too... burlesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony is on the phone.  Little Wendy is busily refilling h whiskey bottle with canned ice tea.  He looks up, insulte

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON, (AS ANDY)
dialogues.text: "Burlesque"?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Andy, I'm calling you up like this because I have the utmost respect for your artistry.  But -- I need your permission to fire him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh dear! (upset) George, this is gonna kill Tony. He's waited his whole life for this break.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: There'll be other shots.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Andy, I have to do it.  He's a terrible actor. Andy thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I guess I understand.  But Ed -- please... let him down gentle.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yes, Andy, I will. Andy hangs up.  A relieved Ed turns to George. ED (cont'd) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony SCREAMS insanely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is stupefied.  The cast stands nervously behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: We had a deal!!

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: I don't know what yer talkin' about. You musta talked to someone else --

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah!!  I talked to Andy Kaufman!

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: I don't know nothin' about no Kaufman.  He's been ridin' my coattails, smearing my reputation. Been usin' my good name, to get places. Ed is livid.  He gazes harshly at Tony -- Tony's burning eyes piercing through the rubber features.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Get off my stage!  You're fired!

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: I GOT A CONTRACT!!  I'm gonna take you to the DEPARTMENT OF LABOR! Suddenly -- FLASH!  Ed looks over.  A REPORTER has a came

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Who're YOU?!

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: I'm from the LA Times.  We're doing a little puff piece on Mr. Clifton. (beat) Mr. Kaufman arranged it. UP IN THE BLEACHERS - George enters.  He looks down at th growing debacle, and winces.  Uh-oh. ONSTAGE - Enraged, Ed blows up.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Security!  Escort this man off the lot!! ONSTAGE - Studio SECURITY GUARDS run over.  They GRAB Ton

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: Stop!  GETCHER HANDS OFF ME! Tony scuffles.  The camera FLASHES. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: LEMME GO
dialogues.text: IN THE BLEACHERS - George stares at this mess... and star giggling. ONSTAGE - Two guards drag Tony to the door. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) You'll be SORRY!  One day I'm gonna OWN this town!! Tony SCREAMS and gets removed.  Dead silence.  Then --

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I don't want those pictures getting out.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (to the reporter) This is a closed set.  You'll have to give me the film in that camera. The Guard reaches for the camera.  An uncertain moment... until Zmuda authoritatively cuts in, from out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: I'll take care of this. Zmuda takes the camera.  He casually starts to make his w for the exit... when Ed suddenly HOLLERS.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Wait -- he's one of THEM! Zmuda gasps.  Two guards go running for him. Zmuda barrels away, trying to escape.  The guards chase. Zmuda races by George, and suddenly palms off the camera into George's arms.  The guards whip by, oblivious. George grimaces, unclear about his loyalties.  He sweatil peers at the timebomb in his hands. And then -- George thrusts it under his jacket.  He bolts for the door and feverishly scampers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George runs for his life.  He knocks aside a rack of costumes and serpentines between people. At the gate, Tony's being dragged, kicking and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: Stop!  HELP!  You wouldn't do this to Wayne Newton -- The guards toss Tony out the gate.  He lands in a heap. In the b.g., George crazily flies by.  He gets out the ex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George doubles over, trying to catch his breath.  He glan down... and Tony is lying next to him.  Little Wendy and Zmuda run up, out of breath. They all look at each other.  There's a moment of understanding.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
dialogues.text: Hey.  Good hustlin'. George slowly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed storms in, insanely angry.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: That asshole!  That FUCKING

dialogues.speaker: BASTARD
dialogues.text: (he SLAMS the door behind him) We had a fuckin' deal, and THAT

dialogues.speaker: COCKSUCKER SHAFTED ME
dialogues.text: Ed is seething.  His SECRETARY timidly speaks.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Um, Ed... you have a phone call --

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Well, um... it's Andy Kaufman... Heh                          Shaking with fury, Ed stares then slowly picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Yeah??? A long pause... then Andy's voice calmly speaks.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You were brilliant. A flabbergasted beat.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You were in the moment.  You became a producer losing his mind. (sincerely joyful) It was the best improv I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT
dialogues.text: He thinks intently about this.  And then... amazingly, a magnificent smiles comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Well -- thank you. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay.  See you next week. Andy hangs up.  Ed just sits there, astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, Zmuda, George and Little Wendy are squeezed in a booth, laughing and celebrating.  They eagerly read the L Times. INSERT - The headline says "WHO IS TONY CLIFTON?"  Below a PHOTO of Tony being thrown off the Taxi set. They all HOWL.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: This is great!  It makes Tony REAL - - three-dimensional!  It's very good for his career. Zmuda reads one paragraph.

dialogues.speaker: ZMUDA
dialogues.text: "Was this in actuality Andy Kaufman? And if it was Andy Kaufman, is Andy Kaufman crazy?"

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (he chortles) Boy, they totally fell for it!  I'm only acting crazy! Hmm.  A few awkward glances. Then -- Andy grins at his meal. ANDY (cont'd) Boy, this is tasty. (he shouts to a

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Hey, can I please have some more seaweed?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slick BOOKER, sitting in a crowded office full of head shots.  He's on the phone.  He's reading the LA Times sto

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER
dialogues.text: Mr. Shapiro, this is Gene Knight, up at Harrah's Tahoe.  We'd like to book Andy Kaufman for our showroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ehh -- Andy doesn't really like playing casinos.  The audiences don't work well for him.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh. Disappointed beat.  The booker thinks. BOOKER (O.S.) (cont'd) What about Tony Clifton?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (startled) Really?!  You want Tony Clifton to headline Harrah's Tahoe??

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (being tricky) Eh, sure.  We're trying to expand our audience base -- and I know the college kids really love Andy Kaufman. George winces.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Look -- I gotta be clear with you. Tony Clifton is NOT Andy Kaufman.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.  I know! (he LAUGHS merrily) Wink wink!  Nudge nudge!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (frustrated) No, I'm serious.  If you book Tony, do NOT EXPECT TO GET ANDY.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING harder) I'll take my chances!! George rolls his eyes in annoyance.  Finally, he shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Fine, be my guest!  Book him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is driving in his convertible.  Suddenly, somethin catches his eye -- and in shock he HITS the brakes.  Thre cars behind him SCREECH crazily, trying not to hit each other. George is oblivious.  He's staring up at a BILLBOARD. The BILLBOARD: It says "HARRAH'S TAHOE PRESENTS, ANDY KAUFMAN & TONY CLIFTON!  TOGETHER ON STAGE!  ONE NIGH

dialogues.speaker: ONLY
dialogues.text: George is flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is shouting into a payphone.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Gene, you misunderstood!!  You're not getting BOTH of them! (upset) It's physically impossible!

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why's that?  You said over and over and over, Tony Clifton is not Andy Kaufman --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I KNOW what I said!  But -- trust me, it's not gonna happen!

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sure it is.  Tony called me himself. He yelled at me, insisting that his dressing room be bigger than Andy's. They're both going on tonight, believe me! George is stupefied.  He looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magnificent HARRAH'S dominates the skyline.  The marquee blares "TONY CLIFTON AND ANDY KAUFMAN!"  George screeches in a rental car.  He jumps out and runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The showroom is packed.  It hums with curiosity.  WAITERS clean off the dinner tables.  George rushes in and is sea in a far booth, with some STRANGERS.  He overhears a heat conversation between a PUSHY MAN and his WIFE.

dialogues.speaker: PUSHY MAN
dialogues.text: You're not listenin'!  It's a VERY simple concept.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE OF PUSHY MAN
dialogues.text: You're making no sense.  How can they be the same person --?

dialogues.speaker: PUSHY MAN
dialogues.text: Trust me!  You'll never see them on stage at the same time! The onstage ORCHESTRA hits a fanfare.  LIGHTS DIM.  Sharp SPOTLIGHTS meet at the foot of the stage.  Suddenly -- To swaggers out, hands over his head in a gesture of triumph Thunderous APPLAUSE.  Tony beams.  The music stops. George leans in, curious as to how Andy will wiggle out o this. Tony bows theatrically, turns back to face the orchestra, and waits.  The NOISE LEVEL slowly drops -- but not entirely.  Tony waits, and waits, and waits... until suddenly he turns towards the audience and SCREAMS FURIOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: SHUT UP
dialogues.text: Everybody looks up, alarmed.  The general murmur almost dies.  Tony stands there, eyes flashing with anger at all the unruly people.  As they quiet down... Tony turns back the orchestra and raises his arms.  The MUSICIANS lift th instruments.  Silence is total -- except for the clank of china. Waiters are serving coffee. Tony spins back around, livid. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: PENGUINS
